newsitem.title: INDIA: INDIAN IPO - Kaveri Telecoms Ltd, opens Feb 6.
newsitem.headline: INDIAN IPO - Kaveri Telecoms Ltd, opens Feb 6.

text.p: The following initial public issue (IPO) by India's Kaveri Telecoms Ltd opens for public subscription on February 6:
Face value Rs 10 per share value
Post Issue Holding of Promoters 39.52 percent.

Kaveri Telecoms is trying to cash in on the growing telecom sector. Incorporated a year back, the company is now tapping the market for equity shares worth 43.6 million rupees. The project has been appraised by Karnataka State Industrial & Investment Development Corporation, which has also agreed to pick up equity worth 20 million rupees in the company. Magnus Capital Corporation of Mauritius shall also subscribe to equity worth 10 million rupees. The project is for expanding the existing capacity of microwave components, antenna and private paging systems from 20,000 units to 60,000 units. The company also has a diversification plan for manufacture of MARR UHF systems. These find application in railways, defence and telecom. However, the company does not have any firm marketing tie up.
The company has a 70 percent market share in its main line of activity.
